results.idea: Momentum of instrument vs. sector index
results.description: Combine instrument short-term returns with sector index momentum. Applied SUGGESTION1 using pv13_revere_index_value and rel_ret_comp. Did not use VECTOR wrapping. Both fields have high coverage; used SUGGESTION4 preference for pv13_revere_index_value (high user/alpha counts). Confidence set to 0.78 because index momentum commonly predicts relative moves.

Use competitors' PageRank (vector) averaged and compare to instrument returns. Applied SUGGESTION2 wrapping pv13_com_page_rank with vec_avg(). Both fields high coverage/userCount per SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.74 based on network centrality predictive power.

Contrast competitors' HITS authority vs hub scores to capture network structural shifts. Applied SUGGESTION2 to pv13_com_rk_au and pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank as vectors and take difference. Both have high coverage; SUGGESTION1 used multiple fields. Confidence 0.66 (moderate).

Leverage sign of customer returns (pv13_custretsig_retsig) combined with company market cap to scale effect. Applied SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 (pv13_revere_index_cap has high counts). No backfill needed. Confidence 0.72.
Detect extremes in market-cap adjusted returns using pv13_revere_index_cap and rel_ret_all. Applied SUGGESTION1 and favored high userCount fields (pv13_revere_index_cap, rel_ret_all). Confidence 0.7.
Use rel_ret_comp (avg competing returns) vs instrument recent return to spot divergence. SUGGESTION1 applied; both fields high coverage/userCount. Confidence 0.75.
Average customers' PageRank (vector) and compare to instrument returns. Applied SUGGESTION2 on pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank (vector) and SUGGESTION4 preference. Confidence 0.68.
Use number of partners (rel_num_part) as stability proxy and scale short-term returns. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; rel_num_part has high user/alpha counts per SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.64.

Compare averaged customers' returns (rel_ret_cust) to competitors' returns to spot idiosyncratic moves. rel_ret_cust coverage <0.6 so applied SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30). Also used rel_ret_comp. Confidence 0.6 due to lower coverage.

Identify instruments whose competitors' PageRank (vec_avg) sharply increases vs their returns. SUGGESTION2 used vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank) and SUGGESTION1 used ts_returns. High coverage/userCount supports signal. Confidence 0.71.

Compare competitors' authority trend with instrument returns. Used vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au) per SUGGESTION2 and ts_returns of instrument proxy. Preference for high-count fields per SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.67.
Capture imbalance in customer graph by dividing hub by authority (vectors). Applied SUGGESTION2 to pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank and pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank. Confidence 0.62.

Use primary sector focused company count (low coverage) backfilled and compare with key sector totals to identify concentrated plays. Applied SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill for primary_sector_focused_company_count and SUGGESTION1 combining pv13_revere_key_sector_total. Confidence 0.55 due to low coverage field.
Leverage number of terminal sectors (pv13_revere_term_sector_total) vs company total to detect specialization. Both have high counts; SUGGESTION1 used both. Confidence 0.6.

Use zipcode (categorical) as proxy for local activity but avoid using it alone. Instead correlate pv13_revere_zipcode (as id) with rel_ret_all via ts_corr — treated as numeric encoding. SUGGESTION4 favored high coverage. Confidence 0.48 (noisy proxy).
Average returns of overlapping-product companies (rel_ret_all) vs instrument recent return to detect lead-lag. Both fields have high coverage and user counts (SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.73.
Use number of competitors (rel_num_comp) to scale momentum — many competitors may dampen moves. SUGGESTION1 used rel_num_comp and ts_returns. rel_num_comp has high userCount. Confidence 0.58.
Compare averaged partners' returns (rel_ret_part) to instrument returns to detect contagion. rel_ret_part high alphaCount so SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.69.
Use vec_stddev of customer PageRank to proxy shifting customer importance; higher volatility predicts downside. Applied SUGGESTION2 vec_stddev(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank). Confidence 0.63.
Detect spikes in competitors' hub scores (vec_max delta) and relate to instrument reaction. Used SUGGESTION2 vec_max(pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank) and ts_delta. Confidence 0.61.
Multiply competitors' average PageRank with competitors' avg returns to capture network-weighted return pressure. Applied SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION2 on pv13_com_page_rank. Confidence 0.7.
Correlate competitors' authority vec_avg with partners' returns (rel_ret_part) to find structural lead-lags. Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.65.
Use pv13_custretsig_retsig sign to filter breakouts in instrument returns: only trade when signs align. Applied SUGGESTION1 and used high-coverage sign field. Confidence 0.71.
Compute information ratio of competitors' returns to identify consistent drivers. Used ts_ir(rel_ret_comp,60) per SUGGESTION1; field has strong counts. Confidence 0.68.
Cross-sectional zscore of competitors' PageRank (vec_avg) to find relative centrality winners. Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.6.
Instruments with sudden increases in partner count (rel_num_part) often mean-revert. Use ts_delta on rel_num_part. Applied SUGGESTION4 due to high counts. Confidence 0.56.
Zscore of rel_ret_comp (high coverage) to pick instruments whose competitors are extreme. SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.66.

Use pv13_revere_comproduct_company (low coverage) backfilled to measure product concentration vs returns. Applied SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.52 due to low coverage and low userCount.
Compare terminal-sector count to avg competitor returns to spot niche outperformers. Both fields used per SUGGESTION1; term sector total high userCount. Confidence 0.61.
Use pv13_revere_level (coverage ~0.62) with ts_std_dev of rel_ret_all to detect unstable sector levels. No backfill required (coverage >=0.6). Confidence 0.53.

Spread between company's market cap and competitors' avg returns to find undervalued smaller caps with strong competitor returns. SUGGESTION1 used pv13_revere_index_cap and rel_ret_comp. Confidence 0.7.
Trend in customers' hub ranks (vec_avg) indicates shifting customer influence impacting sales. Used SUGGESTION2 vec_avg on pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank and ts_delta. Confidence 0.59.
Correlate competitors' PageRank (vec_avg) with partners' returns (rel_ret_part) to detect network-driven partner moves. SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.64.
Use pv13_custretsig_retsig sign to confirm instrument's ts_returns; only take positions when sign matches. Applied SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.69.
High rel_num_all indicates cluttered product space; multiply by negative recent returns for mean-reversion. rel_num_all has high coverage and counts (SUGGESTION4). Confidence 0.57.
Use ts_kurtosis on rel_ret_comp to detect fat-tail competitor moves that may transmit. SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.6.
Ratio of competitors' vec_avg PageRank to company market-cap to find underpriced central firms. SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION4 used. Confidence 0.66.
Group-neutralization avoided; simply zscore rel_num_part to find relative partnership concentration. Field has high user/alpha counts. Confidence 0.55.
ts_ir of rel_ret_comp to measure persistent trend in competitors; apply zscore. SUGGESTION4 favored high alphaCount. Confidence 0.67.
Use vec_avg of customer PageRank and reverse short-term spike (mean-revert). Applied SUGGESTION2. Confidence 0.58.
vec_stddev of competitors' authority indicates unstable competition; used vec_stddev(pv13_com_rk_au) per SUGGESTION2. Confidence 0.6.
Cross-correlation between rel_ret_all and instrument returns to find leading signals. Both high coverage. Confidence 0.7.
pv13_revere_company_total has low coverage so ts_backfill used; compare to rel_num_all to find structural size mismatches. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.5.
Multiply vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank) with ts_returns(rel_ret_comp,3) to emphasize networked return movers. SUGGESTION2/1 applied. Confidence 0.68.
Use vec_avg customer authority and require positive trend to take long signals. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.62.
ts_ir(rel_ret_part,60) identifies stable partner-driven returns; used per SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.65.
High rel_num_comp reduces momentum efficacy; scale ts_returns by inverse competitor count. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.56.
Cross-sectional quantile of rel_ret_cust backfilled to find instruments with extreme customer returns. Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.59.
Compute difference between competitors' hub and authority vec_avgs to find network role shifts. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.6.
Second-difference (ts_delta of ts_delta) of vec_avg PageRank detects accelerating centrality. Applied SUGGESTION2. Confidence 0.63.
ts_std_dev(rel_ret_all,20) spikes indicate contagion risk; use reverse for long bias. Field has good coverage per SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.58.
ts_zscore(ts_returns(pv13_revere_index_value,5),20) identifies mean-revert extremes. High-coverage field used per SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.72.
Divide rel_num_comp by market cap to find small firms with many competitors (vulnerable). SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.54.
ts_corr(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank), rel_ret_part,30) per SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.62.
Spread of ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,10) and instrument returns to capture divergence. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.69.
Multiply vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank) with ts_ir(rel_ret_comp,60) to emphasize consistent central competitors. SUGGESTION2 & 4 applied. Confidence 0.67.
Require partners' returns to be positive (rel_ret_part) before taking long on instrument. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.6.
Single-sector pureplay count (low coverage) backfilled compared to total companies to indicate specialization. Applied SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.49.
ts_arg_max(rel_ret_comp,20) finds lookback index of max competitor return; early peaks may predict reversion. Applied SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.55.

Use vec_count of customer PageRank vector (if available) via vec_avg fallback; here use vec_avg length proxy by vec_sum>0 pattern. Applied SUGGESTION2; assumed vec_count exists. Confidence 0.5 (approximation).
Compare competitors' PageRank vec_avg to terminal sector counts to spot concentrated influential competitors. Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.58.
Use ts_kurtosis/ts_std_dev mix to detect fat-tailed competitor returns (ts_kurtosis(rel_ret_comp,60)). SUGGESTION4 used. Confidence 0.6.
ts_corr(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank), rel_ret_cust,30) with rel_ret_cust backfilled due to coverage <0.6 (SUGGESTION3). Confidence 0.56.
Divide rel_num_comp by rel_num_all to measure relative competitor concentration. Both high coverage; SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.52.
ts_product of vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank) over short window to detect persistent centrality increases. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Customer return IR vs company cap
results.description: Compare ts_ir(rel_ret_cust,60) backfilled with market cap to find small caps with strong customer IR. Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION4. Confidence 0.6.
vec_range(pv13_com_page_rank) to measure disparity among competitors' centrality; large ranges signal dominance by a few. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.59.
Cross-sectional zscore of rel_ret_part to highlight extreme partner-driven opportunities. SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Competitor PageRank vs competitor returns zscore
results.description: zscore of ts_corr between vec_avg PageRank and rel_ret_comp to find strong relationships. SUGGESTION2/1 used. Confidence 0.66.
Multiply vec_avg customer hub rank by rel_ret_cust (backfilled) to find weighted customer-driven returns. Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.58.
ts_delta on rel_num_cust (coverage <0.6) backfilled to detect customer acquisition spikes. Applied SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.54.
ts_ir(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au),60) to find authorities driving consistent returns. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.61.
Divide vec_avg competitors' PageRank by pv13_revere_term to see influence in terminal sectors; pv13_revere_term backfilled if needed (coverage <0.6). SUGGESTION3/2 applied. Confidence 0.52.
If ts_kurtosis(rel_ret_part,60) exceeds threshold (tail), flag for mean-reversion. SUGGESTION4 used. Confidence 0.57.
zscore of ts_zscore(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank),20) to capture cross-sectional centrality extremes. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.6.
ts_returns(rel_ret_comp,1) scaled by market cap to find overnight momentum in competitor returns for small caps. SUGGESTION1/4 applied. Confidence 0.62.
ts_arg_max(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank),20) to detect recent peaks that may revert. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.53.
ts_sum(rel_ret_comp,5) used to capture short-run accumulation of competitor returns; then zscore. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.66.
Multiply vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank) by rel_num_comp to find influential competitor density. SUGGESTION2/1 applied. Confidence 0.59.
ts_arg_min(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank),20) to find recent dips in customer centrality that may presage recovery. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.51.
Correlation ts_corr(rel_num_part, rel_ret_part,30) to find if partners count growth translates to partner returns. SUGGESTION1/4 applied. Confidence 0.56.
ts_decay_linear(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank),10) to emphasize recent PageRank changes. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Company index value vs competitor avg
results.description: Difference between instrument's index value returns and competitors' average returns (rel_ret_comp) to find relative strength. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.7.
Subtract competitors' avg return (rel_ret_comp) from customers' avg return (backfilled rel_ret_cust) to find divergence. Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.55.
Relate vec_range(pv13_com_page_rank) with rel_ret_comp to detect dominance-driven returns. SUGGESTION2/1 applied. Confidence 0.6.
quantile(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au)) to get relative authority percentile among instruments. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.54.
Add vec_avg customer hub and authority to create a combined influence score. SUGGESTION2 used for both fields. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Competitor returns scaled by PageRank dispersion
results.description: Scale rel_ret_comp by inverse of vec_range(pv13_com_page_rank) to favor returns when competition is evenly distributed. Applied SUGGESTION2/1. Confidence 0.57.
Divide rel_ret_part by pv13_revere_index_cap to find small caps with strong partner returns. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.61.
ts_delta(rel_num_comp,7) to spot sudden competitor increases that may pressure margins. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.53.
ts_corr(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), pv13_revere_index_value,30) to find network centrality impact on index value. SUGGESTION2/1 applied. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Customers' PageRank product with competitors' returns
results.description: multiply(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank), rel_ret_comp) to weight competitor returns by customer centrality. SUGGESTION2/1 applied. Confidence 0.59.
Bucket ts_returns(rel_ret_all,5) into deciles to trade extremes. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.62.
multiply(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), ts_ir(rel_ret_comp,60)) emphasizing stable returns from central competitors. SUGGESTION2/4 applied. Confidence 0.66.
trade_when(greater(ts_delta(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank),3),0), take signal) to only act on rising authority. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.55.
zscore(ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,20)) to highlight extreme competitor return trends. SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.65.
Divide vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank) by pv13_revere_index_cap to find disproportionately central small firms. SUGGESTION2/4 applied. Confidence 0.63.
ts_decay_linear(rel_ret_part,10) to prioritize recent partner returns. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.58.
reverse(ts_delta(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank),5)) to take contrarian positions when centrality spikes. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.56.
Divide ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,60) by pv13_revere_index_cap to find small caps with strong customer returns; applied SUGGESTION3/4. Confidence 0.6.
ts_corr(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au), ts_delay(rel_ret_comp,1),30) to find lagged effects of authority on returns. SUGGESTION2/1 used. Confidence 0.61.
ts_corr(rel_num_part, vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank),30) to see if more partners correlate with competitor centrality. SUGGESTION2/1 applied. Confidence 0.52.
sign(ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,3)) to extract consensus direction among competitors. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.6.
group-operators avoided; use vec_avg customer authority normalized by vec_stddev to find stable influencers. Applied SUGGESTION2. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Competitor return momentum filter by PageRank
results.description: Only take competitor return momentum when vec_avg PageRank is rising: trade_when with ts_delta(vec_avg(...)). SUGGESTION2/1 applied. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Index value vs customer return correlation
results.description: ts_corr(pv13_revere_index_value, ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,60),30) to detect customer-driven index moves. Applied SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.55.
multiply(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au), rel_ret_comp) to emphasize returns from authoritative competitors. SUGGESTION2/1 used. Confidence 0.62.
ts_zscore(ts_returns(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank),3),20) to detect momentum in customer centrality. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.56.
If ts_count_nans(rel_ret_comp,7) spikes it indicates data gaps/competition shocks; use as risk filter. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.5.
ts_corr(ts_delta(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank),3), ts_returns(pv13_revere_index_value,3),30) per SUGGESTION2/1. Confidence 0.58.
ts_arg_max(rel_ret_part,20) to find recency of maximum partner return; used to tilt positions. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.54.
Divide vec_avg customer authority by pv13_revere_key_sector_total to find influential customers relative to company focus. SUGGESTION2/1 applied. Confidence 0.53.
Long instruments with rising competitor PageRank and short with falling PageRank using ts_delta(vec_avg(...)). SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.6.
Subtract rel_ret_comp from rel_ret_all to capture differences between overlapping-product firms and pure competitors. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.58.
quantile(pv13_revere_index_cap) to bucket firms by cap and then apply size-based tilts. SUGGESTION4 used. Confidence 0.65.
vec_min(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) to find customers with minimal influence — potential niches. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.45.
reverse(ts_sum(rel_ret_comp,3)) to capture short-term reversion in competitor returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.6.
